text: Elias Lönnrot (9 April 1802 – 19 March 1884) was a Finnish philologist. He collected traditional spoken poems and made a book of them. He made Finland's national epic, Kalevala.Lönnrot, Elias (1802 - 1884) The National Biography of Finland This is a book of traditional folk stories and poems. He collected these during several journeys across Finland, Karelia, and parts of Russia and the Baltic countries. Lönnrot, Mikael Agricola and Aleksis Kivi are regarded fathers of a national literature in Finnish.Kivi, Aleksis (1834 - 1872) The National Biography of Finland Lönnrot also the first book about plants in Finland, Flora Fennica () in 1860. He was born and died in Sammatti, an old town in Uusimaa. == References == ==Other websites== Category:1802 births Category:1884 deaths Category:Linguists Category:Finnish scientists Category:Botanists Category:Christian writers Category:Lutherans
title: Elias Lönnrot
